name: Kepler-262
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-262 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-262 is a star with 0.775 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.88 times its radius. It is located 2035.47 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-262 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-262 b

Kepler-262 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.06 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-262.

The mass of Kepler-262 b is 2.00 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-262 b is 1.36 that of Earth. At 2.00 Earth masses, Kepler-262 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-262 c

Kepler-262 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 21.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-262.

The mass of Kepler-262 c is 3.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-262 c is 1.64 that of Earth. At 3.14 Earth masses, Kepler-262 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-262, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
